citation.article-title: Litorimicrobium taeanense gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from a sandy beach
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Litorimicrobium (Li.to.ri.mi.cro′bi.um. L. n. litus -oris sand beach; N.L. neut. n. microbium microbe; N.L. neut. n. Litorimicrobium microbe living in a sand beach).
Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, non-motile, ovoid rods.
The isoprenoid quinone detected is Q-10.
The predominant fatty acid is C18 : 1ω7c.
The major cellular polar lipids are PG, DPG, PC, an unidentified AL, an unidentified PL and an unidentified L.
The major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C18 : 1ω7c 11-methyl, C12 : 1 3-OH, C16 : 0 2-OH, C16 : 0 and unknown ECL 11.799.
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the family Rhodobacteraceae of the class Alphaproteobacteria.
The type species is Litorimicrobium taeanense.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 62.4 mol% (HPLC).
